intro: Phacelia curvipes f. macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered phacelia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are showy and attract various pollinators. This subspecies is noted for its larger floral buds compared to the typical form of Phacelia curvipes.
